p: Besides the above AIDS-defining cancers, HIV infection is associated with increased incidence of a number of other malignancies. The most frequent HIV-associated cancers include lung cancer, hepatocellular carcinoma, Hodgkinâ€™s lymphoma, oropharyngeal cancers, as well as genital and anal cancers [ 2]. In the majority of cases, oncogenesis is mediated by the co-infection with an oncovirus, in which HIV-induced immune dysregulation facilitates its immune evasion and tumorigenesis.
